title: Authors and Citation
text: Taudière (2022). MiscMetabar: Miscellaneous functions metabarcoding analysis. R package version 0.22, https://github.com/adrientaudiere/MiscMetabar.
code: @Manual{,   title = {MiscMetabar: Miscellaneous functions for metabarcoding analysis},   author = {Adrien Taudière},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.22},   url = {https://github.com/adrientaudiere/MiscMetabar}, }

title: Miscellaneous functions for metabarcoding analysis
text: goal MiscMetabar complete great packages dada2, phyloseq targets. See pkdown site .

title: Miscellaneous functions for metabarcoding analysis
text: CRAN version MiscMetabar now. can install development version GitHub :
code: install.packages("devtools") #> Installation du package dans '/home/adrien/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.1' #> (car 'lib' n'est pas spécifié) devtools::install_github("adrientaudiere/MiscMetabar") #> Skipping install of 'MiscMetabar' from a github remote, the SHA1 (fc296a84) has not changed since last install. #>   Use `force = TRUE` to force installation

title: Miscellaneous functions for metabarcoding analysis
code: library("MiscMetabar") #> Le chargement a nécessité le package : ggplot2 #> Le chargement a nécessité le package : phyloseq #> Le chargement a nécessité le package : dada2 #> Le chargement a nécessité le package : Rcpp #> Le chargement a nécessité le package : magrittr library("phyloseq") library("magrittr") data("data_fungi") summary_plot_phyloseq(data_fungi)

what: Create an interactive table of the tax_table
title: Miscellaneous functions for metabarcoding analysis
code: data("GlobalPatterns") tax_datatable(subset_taxa(GlobalPatterns,              rowSums(GlobalPatterns@otu_table) > 100000))

title: Miscellaneous functions for metabarcoding analysis
code: gp <- subset_taxa(GlobalPatterns, GlobalPatterns@tax_table[, 1] == "Archaea") sankey_phyloseq(gp, taxa = c(1:5))

what: Circle for visualise distribution of taxa in function of samples variables
title: Miscellaneous functions for metabarcoding analysis
code: otu_circle(gp, "SampleType", taxa = "Class") #> Only 4 modalities are plot (44.44%). Use 'min_prop_mod' to plot more samples. #> Only 4 taxa are plot (44.44%). Use 'min_prop_tax' to plot more taxa

what: MiscMetabar: Miscellaneous functions for metabarcoding analysis — MiscMetabar-package
title: MiscMetabar: Miscellaneous functions for metabarcoding analysis — MiscMetabar-package
text: Functions help analyse visualise metabarcoding data. Mainly based phyloseq dada2 packages.

title: Plot accumulation curves for phyloseq-class object — accu_plot
code: accu_plot(   physeq,   fact = NULL,   nb_seq = TRUE,   step = NULL,   by.fact = FALSE,   ci_col = NULL,   col = NULL,   lwd = 3,   leg = TRUE,   print_sam_names = FALSE,   ci = 2,   ... )

title: Plot accumulation curves for phyloseq-class object — accu_plot
text: physeq (required): phyloseq-class object. fact (required): Name factor physeq@sam_data used plot different lines nb_seq (logical): Either plot accumulation curves using sequences using samples step (integer): distance among points calculated plot lines. low value give better plot time consuming. used nb_seq = TRUE. .fact (logical): First merge OTU table factor plot one line factor ci_col : Color vector confidence intervall. use nb_seq = FALSE. nb_seq = TRUE, can use ggplot modify plot. col : Color vector lines. use nb_seq = FALSE. nb_seq = TRUE, can use ggplot modify plot. lwd (default = 3): thickness lines. use nb_seq = FALSE. leg (logical): Plot legend . use nb_seq = FALSE. print_sam_names (logical): Print samples names ? use nb_seq = TRUE. ci (default = 2) : Confidence intervall value used multiply standard error plot confidence intervall ... Additional arguments passed ggplot nb_seq = TRUE plot nb_seq = FALSE

title: Plot accumulation curves for phyloseq-class object — accu_plot
text: ggplot2 plot representing richness accumulation plot nb_seq = TRUE, else, nb_seq = FALSE return base plot.

title: Plot accumulation curves for phyloseq-class object — accu_plot
text: Adrien Taudière

title: Plot accumulation curves for phyloseq-class object — accu_plot
code: if (FALSE) { data("GlobalPatterns") GP <- subset_taxa(GlobalPatterns, GlobalPatterns@tax_table[, 1] == 'Archaea') accu_plot(GP, 'SampleType', nb_seq = TRUE,  by.fact = TRUE) }

title:
Recluster sequences of an object of class physeq
(e.g. OTUs or ASV from dada) — asv2otu
code: asv2otu(   physeq,   nproc = 1,   method = "IdClusters",   id = 0.97,   vsearchpath = "vsearch" )

title:
Recluster sequences of an object of class physeq
(e.g. OTUs or ASV from dada) — asv2otu
text: physeq (required): phyloseq-class object. nproc (default 1) Set number cpus/processors use clustering method (default IdClusters) Set clustering method. IdClusters use DECIPHER::IdClusters fonction, vsearch use vsearch software (https://github.com/torognes/vsearch/) arguments -cluster_fast -strand id (default=0.97): level identity cluster vsearchpath (default = "vsearch"): path vsearch

title:
Recluster sequences of an object of class physeq
(e.g. OTUs or ASV from dada) — asv2otu
text: new object class physeq

title:
Recluster sequences of an object of class physeq
(e.g. OTUs or ASV from dada) — asv2otu
text: function use speedyseq::merge_taxa_vec function merge taxa clusters. default tax_adjust = 1L. See man page speedyseq::merge_taxa_vec.

Recluster sequences of an object of class physeq

title:
Blast some sequence against refseq slot of a phyloseq-class
object. — blast_to_phyloseq
code: blast_to_phyloseq(   physeq,   seq2search,   blastpath = NULL,   id_cut = 90,   bit_score_cut = 1e-10,   unique_per_seq = FALSE,   score_filter = TRUE,   list_no_output_query = FALSE )

title:
Blast some sequence against refseq slot of a phyloseq-class
object. — blast_to_phyloseq
text: physeq (required): phyloseq-class object. seq2search (required): path fasta file blastpath (default = NULL): path blast program id_cut (default = 90): cut identity percent keep result bit_score_cut (default = 1e-10): cut bit score keep result unique_per_seq (default = FALSE) : return first match sequence seq2search score_filter (default = TRUE): results filter score. FALSE, id_cut bit_score_cut ignored list_no_output_query (default FALSE): result table include query sequences blastn find correspondence

title:
Blast some sequence against refseq slot of a phyloseq-class

title: Graphical representation of hill number 0, 1 and 2 accross a factor — hill_phyloseq
code: hill_phyloseq(physeq, variable, color_fac = NA, letters = FALSE)

title: Graphical representation of hill number 0, 1 and 2 accross a factor — hill_phyloseq
text: physeq (required): phyloseq-class object variable (required): variable test color_fac (optional): variable color barplot letters (optional, default=FALSE): set TRUE, plot show letters based p-values comparison. Use multcompLetters function package multcompLetters.

title: Graphical representation of hill number 0, 1 and 2 accross a factor — hill_phyloseq
text: list 4 ggplot2 plot. plot_Hill_0 : boxplot Hill number 0 (= species richness) variable plot_Hill_1 : boxplot Hill number 1 (= Shannon index) variable plot_Hill_2 : boxplot Hill number 2 (= Simpson index) variable plot_tuckey : plot result Tuckey HSD test

title: Calculate hill number and compute Tuckey post-hoc test — hill_tuckey_phyloseq
code: hill_tuckey_phyloseq(physeq, modality)

text: physeq (required): phyloseq-class object. modality (required): variable test

text: ggplot2 object

title: Calculate hill number and compute Tuckey post-hoc test — hill_tuckey_phyloseq
text: Adrien Taudière

title: Calculate hill number and compute Tuckey post-hoc test — hill_tuckey_phyloseq
code: data("GlobalPatterns") GlobalPatterns@sam_data[, "Soil_logical"] <-   ifelse(GlobalPatterns@sam_data[, "SampleType"] == "Soil", "Soil", "Not Soil") hill_tuckey_phyloseq(GlobalPatterns, "Soil_logical")

what: Make Krona files using KronaTools. — krona
title: Make Krona files using KronaTools. — krona
text: Need installation kronatools computer (installation instruction). Function merge_krona allows merging multiple html files one interactive krona file

title: Make Krona files using KronaTools. — krona
code: krona(   physeq,   file = "krona.html",   nb_seq = TRUE,   ranks = "All",   add_unassigned_rank = 0,   name = NULL )

title: Make Krona files using KronaTools. — krona
text: physeq (required): phyloseq-class object. file (required): location html file save nb_seq (logical, default TRUE): true, Krona set distribution sequences taxonomy. False, Krona set distribution OTUs taxonomy. ranks (default=""): Number taxonomic ranks plot (num column tax_table physeq object). Default setting plot ranks (argument ''). add_unassigned_rank (number; default = 0). Add unassigned rank inferior 'add_unassigned_rank' necessary name (default=NULL) : name intermediary files, usefull name krona dataset merge using merge_krona

title: Make Krona files using KronaTools. — krona
text: html file

title:
Lulu reclustering of class physeq (forked from https://github.com/tobiasgf/lulu).
See https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-017-01312-x for more information on the method.
 — lulu_phyloseq
text: physeq (required): phyloseq-class object. nproc (default 1) Set number cpus/processors use clustering id (default = 0.84): id --usearch_global vsearchpath (default = "vsearch"): path vsearch verbose (Logical): true, print additional messages clean_physeq (Logical, default = FALSE) true, empty samples empty ASV discarded clustering.

title:
Lulu reclustering of class physeq (forked from https://github.com/tobiasgf/lulu).
See https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-017-01312-x for more information on the method.
 — lulu_phyloseq
text: list object "new_physeq": new phyloseq object (class physeq) "discrepancy_vector": vector discrepancy showing taxonomic level proportion identic value lulu reclustering. value 0.6 stands 60% ASV re-clusering identical value re-clustering. word, 40% ASV assigned different taxonomic value. NA value counted discrepancy. "res_lulu": list result lulu function "merged_ASV": data.frame used merged ASV

title: Plot OTU circle for phyloseq-class object — otu_circle
code: otu_circle(   physeq = NULL,   fact = NULL,   taxa = "Order",   nb_seq = TRUE,   rarefy = FALSE,   min_prop_tax = 0.01,   min_prop_mod = 0.1,   gap_degree = NULL,   start_degree = NULL,   row_col = NULL,   grid_col = NULL,   log10trans = F,   ... )

title: Plot OTU circle for phyloseq-class object — otu_circle
text: physeq (required): phyloseq-class object. fact (required): Name factor cluster samples modalities. Need physeq@sam_data. taxa (Default:'Order'): Name taxonomic rank interest nb_seq (Default: TRUE): Represent number sequences number OTUs (nb_seq = FALSE) rarefy (logical): samples modalities need rarefy order compare amount sequences? min_prop_tax (Default: 0.01): minimum proportion taxon ploted min_prop_mod (Default: 0.1) : minimum proportion modalities ploted gap_degree : Gap two neighbour sectors. can single value vector. vector, first value corresponds gap first sector. start_degree : starting degree circle begins draw. Note degree measured standard polar coordinate means always reverse-clockwise. row_col : Color vector row grid_col : Grid colors correspond sectors. length vector either 1 number sectors. preferred grid_col named vector names correspond sectors. named vector, order grid_col corresponds order sectors. log10trans (logical): sequence log10 transformed (precisely log10(1+x))? ... Additional arguments passed chordDiagram circos.par

title: Plot OTU circle for phyloseq-class object — otu_circle
text: chordDiagram plot representing distribution OTUs sequences different modalities factor fact

title: Plot OTU circle for phyloseq-class object — otu_circle
text: Adrien Taudière

title: Plot OTU circle for phyloseq-class object — otu_circle
code: data("GlobalPatterns")  GP <- subset_taxa(GlobalPatterns, GlobalPatterns@tax_table[, 1] == "Archaea")  otu_circle(GP, "SampleType") #> Only 4 modalities are plot (44.44%). Use 'min_prop_mod' to plot more samples. #> Only 5 taxa are plot (45.45%). Use 'min_prop_tax' to plot more taxa #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘circlize’ if (FALSE) {  otu_circle(GP, "SampleType", nb_seq = FALSE)  otu_circle(GP, "SampleType", taxa = "Class") }

what: Convert phyloseq OTU count data into DGEList for edgeR package — phyloseq_to_edgeR
title: Convert phyloseq OTU count data into DGEList for edgeR package — phyloseq_to_edgeR
text: details.

title: Convert phyloseq OTU count data into DGEList for edgeR package — phyloseq_to_edgeR
code: phyloseq_to_edgeR(physeq, group, method = "RLE", ...)

title: Convert phyloseq OTU count data into DGEList for edgeR package — phyloseq_to_edgeR
text: physeq (required).  phyloseq-class otu_table-class object. latter appropriate group argument also vector factor length equal nsamples(physeq). group (required). character vector factor giving experimental group/condition sample/library. Alternatively, may provide name sample variable. name among output sample_variables(physeq), case get_variable(physeq, group) return either character vector factor. passed DGEList, may find details examples documentation. method (Optional). label edgeR-implemented normalization use. See calcNormFactors supported options details. default option "RLE", scaling factor method proposed Anders Huber (2010). time writing, edgeR package supported following options method argument: c("TMM", "RLE", "upperquartile", "none"). ... Additional arguments passed DGEList

title: Heat tree from metacoder package using tax_table slot — physeq_heat_tree
code: physeq_heat_tree(physeq, taxonomic_level = NULL, ...)

title: Heat tree from metacoder package using tax_table slot — physeq_heat_tree
text: physeq (required): phyloseq-class object taxonomic_level (Default: NULL): vector selected taxonomic level using column numbers (e.g. taxonomic_level = c(1:7)) ... : Arguments parsed heat_tree

title: Heat tree from metacoder package using tax_table slot — physeq_heat_tree
text: plot

title: Heat tree from metacoder package using tax_table slot — physeq_heat_tree
text: Adrien Taudière

title: Heat tree from metacoder package using tax_table slot — physeq_heat_tree
code: if (FALSE) { data("GlobalPatterns") GPsubset <- subset_taxa(   GlobalPatterns,   GlobalPatterns@tax_table[, 1] == "Bacteria" ) GPsubset <- subset_taxa(   GPsubset,   rowSums(GPsubset@otu_table) > 1000 ) GPsubset <- subset_taxa(GPsubset, rowSums(is.na(GPsubset@tax_table)) == 0)  physeq_heat_tree(GPsubset,   node_size = n_obs,   node_color = n_obs,   node_label = taxon_names,   tree_label = taxon_names,   node_size_trans = "log10 area" ) }

title: Plot DESeq2 results for a phyloseq or a DESeq2 object. — plot_deseq2_phyloseq
code: plot_deseq2_phyloseq(   data,   contrast = NULL,   tax_table = NULL,   alpha = 0.01,   taxa = "Genus",   select_taxa = "No",   color_tax = "Phylum",   tax_depth = NULL,   verbose = TRUE,   jitter_width = 0.1,   ... )

title: Plot DESeq2 results for a phyloseq or a DESeq2 object. — plot_deseq2_phyloseq
text: data (required): phyloseq-class DESeqDataSet-class object. contrast (required):argument specifies comparison extract object build results table. See results man page details. tax_table : Required data DESeqDataSet-class object. taxonomic table used find taxa color_taxa arguments. data phyloseq-class object, data@tax_table used. alpha (default = 0.01): significance cutoff used optimizing independent filtering. adjusted p-value cutoff (FDR) value 0.1, alpha set value. taxa (default = 'Genus'): taxonomic level interest select_taxa (default = ''): logical vector select taxa plot color_tax (default = 'Phylum'): taxonomic level used color color vector. tax_depth (default = NULL): Taxonomic depth test differential distribution among contrast. Null analysis done OTU (.e. Species) level. Null data need phyloseq-class object. verbose : whether function print information computation jitter_width (default=0.1) : width jitter positionning ... Additional arguments passed DESeq ggplot

title: Plot DESeq2 results for a phyloseq or a DESeq2 object. — plot_deseq2_phyloseq
text: ggplot2 plot representing DESeq2 results

title: Plot DESeq2 results for a phyloseq or a DESeq2 object. — plot_deseq2_phyloseq
text: Adrien Taudière

title: Plot DESeq2 results for a phyloseq or a DESeq2 object. — plot_deseq2_phyloseq
code: data("GlobalPatterns") GP <- subset_taxa(GlobalPatterns, GlobalPatterns@tax_table[, 1] == "Archaea") GP <- subset_samples(GP, GP@sam_data$SampleType %in% c("Soil", "Skin")) #> Error in h(simpleError(msg, call)): error in evaluating the argument 'x' in selecting a method for function '%in%': object 'GP' not found res <- DESeq2::DESeq(phyloseq_to_deseq2(GP, ~SampleType),   test = "Wald", fitType = "local" ) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘DESeq2’ plot_deseq2_phyloseq(res, c("SampleType", "Soil", "Skin"),   tax_table = GP@tax_table, color_tax = "Kingdom" ) #> Error in plot_deseq2_phyloseq(res, c("SampleType", "Soil", "Skin"), tax_table = GP@tax_table,     color_tax = "Kingdom"): object 'res' not found plot_deseq2_phyloseq(res, c("SampleType", "Soil", "Skin"),   tax_table = GP@tax_table, color_tax = "Kingdom",   alpha = 0.7 ) #> Error in plot_deseq2_phyloseq(res, c("SampleType", "Soil", "Skin"), tax_table = GP@tax_table,     color_tax = "Kingdom", alpha = 0.7): object 'res' not found

title: Plot edgeR results for a phyloseq or a edgeR object. — plot_edgeR_phyloseq
code: plot_edgeR_phyloseq(   physeq,   contrast = NULL,   alpha = 0.01,   taxa = "Genus",   color_tax = "Phylum",   verbose = TRUE,   ... )

title: Plot edgeR results for a phyloseq or a edgeR object. — plot_edgeR_phyloseq
text: physeq (required): phyloseq-class object. contrast (required):argument specifies comparison extract object build results table. See results man page details. alpha (default = 0.01): significance cutoff used optimizing independent filtering. adjusted p-value cutoff (FDR) value 0.1, alpha set value. taxa (default = 'Genus'): taxonomic level interest color_tax (default = 'Phylum'): taxonomic level used color assignation verbose (default = FALSE): whether function print information computation ... Additional arguments passed exactTest ggplot

title: Plot edgeR results for a phyloseq or a edgeR object. — plot_edgeR_phyloseq
text: ggplot2 plot representing edgeR results

text: Adrien Taudière

title: Plot edgeR results for a phyloseq or a edgeR object. — plot_edgeR_phyloseq
code: if (FALSE) { data(GlobalPatterns) plot_edgeR_phyloseq(GlobalPatterns, c("SampleType", "Soil", "Feces"),   color_tax = "Kingdom" ) plot_edgeR_phyloseq(GlobalPatterns, c("SampleType", "Soil", "Feces"),   taxa = "Class", color_tax = "Kingdom" ) }

title: Plot the result of a mt test (mt) — plot_mt
code: plot_mt(mt = NULL, alpha = 0.05, color_tax = "Class", taxa = "Species")

title: Plot the result of a mt test (mt) — plot_mt
text: mt (required): result mt test alpha (default = 0.05): Choose cut p-value plot taxa color_tax : taxonomic level color points taxa : taxonomic level choose x-positioning data("GlobalPatterns") res <- mt(GlobalPatterns, "SampleType", test="f") plot_mt(res, color_tax = "Phylum") + scale_color_hue()

title: Plot the result of a mt test (mt) — plot_mt
text: ggplot2 plot result mt test

title: Sankey plot of phyloseq-class object — sankey_phyloseq
code: sankey_phyloseq(   physeq = NULL,   fact = NULL,   taxa = c(1:4),   nb_seq = FALSE,   min_prop_tax = 0,   tax2remove = NULL,   units = NULL,   symbol2sub = c("\\.", "-"),   ... )

title: Sankey plot of phyloseq-class object — sankey_phyloseq
text: physeq (required): phyloseq-class object. fact (Optional): Name factor cluster samples modalities. Need physeq@sam_data. taxa (Default: c(1:4)): vector taxonomic rank plot nb_seq (Default: FALSE): Represent number sequences number OTUs (nb_seq = FALSE). Note ploting number sequences slower. min_prop_tax (Default: 0): minimum proportion taxon ploted. EXPERIMENTAL. moment links min.prop. tax discard sankey network resulting sometimes weird plot. tax2remove : vector taxonomic groups remove analysis (e.g. c('Incertae sedis', 'unidentified')) units : character string describing physical units () Value symbol2sub (default = c('\.', '-')): vector symbol delete taxonomy ... Additional arguments passed sankeyNetwork

title: Sankey plot of phyloseq-class object — sankey_phyloseq
text: sankeyNetwork plot representing taxonomic distribution OTUs sequences. fact set, represent distribution last taxonomic level modalities fact

title: Sankey plot of phyloseq-class object — sankey_phyloseq
text: Adrien Taudière

title: Sankey plot of phyloseq-class object — sankey_phyloseq
code: data("GlobalPatterns") GP <- subset_taxa(GlobalPatterns, GlobalPatterns@tax_table[, 1] == "Archaea") sankey_phyloseq(GP, fact = "SampleType") #> Warning: NAs introduced by coercion #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘networkD3’ sankey_phyloseq(GP, taxa = c(1:4), min_prop_tax = 0.01) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘networkD3’ sankey_phyloseq(GP, taxa = c(1:4), min_prop_tax = 0.01, nb_seq = TRUE) #> Error in loadNamespace(x): there is no package called ‘networkD3’

title: Subset taxa using a taxa control (e.g. truffle root tips) through 3 methods. — subset_taxa_tax_control
code: subset_taxa_tax_control(   physeq,   taxa_distri,   method = "mean",   min_diff_for_cutoff = 10 )

title: Subset taxa using a taxa control (e.g. truffle root tips) through 3 methods. — subset_taxa_tax_control
text: physeq (required): phyloseq-class object. taxa_distri (required): vector length equal number samples number sequences per samples taxa control method (default = "mean"): method calculate cut-value. 6 methods: ()   cutoff_seq: discard taxa less number sequence taxa control, (ii)  cutoff_mixt: using mixture models, (iii) cutoff_diff: using minimum difference threshold (need argument min_diff_for_cutoff) (iv)  min: minimum three firsts methods (v)   max: maximum three firsts methods (vi)  mean: mean three firsts methods min_diff_for_cutoff (default = 10): argument method cutoff_diff

Track the number of reads (= sequences), samples and cluster (e.g. ASV)
from various objects including dada-class and derep-class. — track_wkflow
text: list_of_objects (required): list objects obj_names (default: NULL) : list names corresponding list objects clean_physeq (Logical, default = FALSE) true, empty samples empty ASV discarded clustering.

Track the number of reads (= sequences), samples and cluster (e.g. ASV)

title:
Track the number of reads (= sequences), samples and cluster (e.g. ASV)
from various objects including dada-class and derep-class. — track_wkflow
text: List fastq fastg.gz files -> nb reads samples List dada-class -> nb reads, clusters (ASV) samples List derep-class -> nb reads, clusters (unique sequences) samples Matrix samples x clusters (e.g. otu_table) -> nb reads, clusters samples Phyloseq-class -> nb reads, clusters samples

title: Venn diagram of phyloseq-class object — venn_phyloseq
code: venn_phyloseq(physeq, fact, min_nb_seq = 0, print_values = TRUE)

title: Venn diagram of phyloseq-class object — venn_phyloseq
text: physeq (required): phyloseq-class object. fact (required): Name factor cluster samples modalities. Need physeq@sam_data. min_nb_seq (Default: 0)): minimum number sequences OTUs samples take count OTUs sample. example, min_nb_seq=2,value 2 less OTU table change 0 analysis print_values (logical) : Print () table number OTUs combination. print_values TRUE object ggplot object. Please use print_values = FALSE want add ggplot function (cf example). data("enterotype") venn_phyloseq(enterotype, fact = 'SeqTech') venn_phyloseq(enterotype, fact = 'ClinicalStatus') venn_phyloseq(enterotype, fact = 'Nationality', print_values = F) venn_phyloseq(enterotype, fact = 'ClinicalStatus', print_values = F) + scale_fill_hue() venn_phyloseq(enterotype, fact = 'ClinicalStatus', print_values = F) + scale_fill_hue()
